title: 115_s1776
content: The Act may be cited as the "Agricultural Energy Programs Reauthorization Act of 2017". The Act includes a section on the Biobased Markets Program. Section 9002 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to include renewable chemicals in the biobased products labeling program. The Secretary will provide education and outreach to stakeholders. Manufacturers of renewable chemicals and biobased products will be classified under specific NAICS codes. The Secretary and the Secretary of Commerce will develop NAICS codes for renewable chemicals and biobased products manufacturers. Amendments include a national testing center registry and increased funding for fiscal years 2019 through 2023. The amendments include adding new categories for renewable chemicals and biobased products manufacturers in the NAICS codes, establishing a national testing center registry, and increasing funding until 2023. The amendments include establishing a national testing center registry and increasing funding until 2023 for biorefinery, renewable chemical, and biobased product manufacturing assistance. Section 9003 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to include funding of $75,000,000 annually for loan guarantees for biorefineries until 2023. The amendments also involve expanding support for renewable chemicals and biobased products. SEC. 4. The Bioenergy Program for Advanced Biofuels is amended to allocate $5,000,000 annually for fiscal years 2018 through 2023. SEC. 5. The Rural Energy for America Program is also updated. The definition of a renewable energy system is expanded to include distribution components and ancillary infrastructure. Funding for renewable energy programs is also amended. The funding for renewable energy programs is increased to $150,000,000 annually for fiscal years 2018 through 2023. Additionally, not more than 30 percent of the funding can be used for specific renewable energy technologies or energy efficiency improvements. SEC. 6. Biomass research and development funding is set at $20,000,000 annually for fiscal years 2019 through 2023. SEC. 7. Feedstock flexibility program deadlines are extended to 2023. SEC. 8. Biofuels and biobased product feedstock program is established for wildland fire protection. Section 9011 of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to establish a biofuels and biobased product feedstock and wildland fire protection program. This includes redesignating paragraphs and making amendments to the existing program. The Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to establish a program for biofuels, biobased products, and wildland fire protection. Amendments include adding algae and animal waste as feedstock, redesignating paragraphs, and defining the program. The Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to establish a program for biofuels, biobased products, and wildland fire protection. The amendments include changing the program name, adding new feedstock options, and specifying project areas. The Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to establish a program for biofuels, biobased products, and wildland fire protection. The amendments include changing the program name, adding new feedstock options, specifying project areas, and making adjustments to various paragraphs within the legislation. The Secretary may use available funds to provide payments to project sponsors for transportation costs of projects removing hazardous woody fuel. Projects in high wildfire risk or needing restoration will be considered for payments. The Secretary may provide payments to project sponsors for transportation costs of projects removing hazardous woody fuel in high wildfire risk areas or needing restoration. As a condition for receiving payment, a producer must leave at least 30 percent of woody material uncollected. The Secretary shall allocate $70,000,000 annually from the Commodity Credit Corporation funds for fiscal years 2019 through 2023 for program implementation. Additionally, $20,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated annually for the same period. The Secretary must allocate at least $50,000,000 for transportation payments for hazardous woody fuel reduction projects. COMMUNITY WOOD ENERGY PROGRAM amended to extend to 2023. SEC. 10. Effective date is October 1, 2018.
